column4: Can anyone tell me why Ubuntu doesn't see any of my Sata Harddrives?
if they are additional internal drives you might have to add them to the fstab file so Ubuntu will know about them
i am assuming this can be done during the text install?  just go to the terminal?
i'd recommend you use "gksu gedit /etc/fstab" but you'll need to know what the dev id of your drives is and create mount points for them - a little research on your end may be required...
all my drives are sata actually, but my first drive starts on the Sata 2 controller not sata 1.
i can't even get all the way into the boot live cd inorder to use gedit.
when i say it doesn't recognize the drives it also means it fails to load the live cd as there are no drives available.
use "sudo fdisk -l" in a terminal to find all you correct /dev/sdX# that you'll need, how many partitions do you want to mount?
oh man you you running a livecd?
as long as i get 1 drive up then i would be fine.  i can format and mount the second drive after install.
if you are then you don't need fstab!  just mount the drives!
no, not running a live cd now.
ok, then use the fdisk -l to find your partitions!  sd then a letter and number!
so far all i have been able to do on this machine is get ubuntu running in vmware but i want ubuntu to be the main OS on this machine and then just load windows in vm when needed
you also need to know what type of partition they are ext3 ext4 nfts etc
you are aware that there is no gaming in VMs right?
this machine is not for gaming its for office work / serviing up files   i have another machine for games
